title: The Apple Mac mini may not be dead after all | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**It has been three years since Apple updated the Mac mini desktop computer,
but the company is expected to revive the brand at today’s big event.**

Some light at the end tunnel for fans of the self-contained square slab
emerged via an email conversation which allegedly took place between Apple CEO
Tim Cook and a long-suffering Mac mini user, who asked when to expect an
upgrade.

In an exchange sent to [MacRumors](https://www.macrumors.com/2017/10/19/tim-
cook-mac-mini-important-product/?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=webfeeds), Cook
revealed plans for the Mac mini to be “an important part of our product line
going forward.”

Last October, Cook said “it is not time to share details” but the inference
appears to be a Mac mini revamp was in the pipeline – and today, just over a
year later, is when some new Apple mini PCs finally get to crawl into the
light.

**Related:[Mac Mini 2018 price and release
date](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/mac-mini-2018-pro-release-
date-3552537)**

### Bring your own screen

The $499/£479 Mac mini is a modular desktop PC. It’s a hub which comes without
any peripherals or its own display, letting you pay less for the privilege of
running a macOS desktop, using whatever existing
[monitors](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-monitors-3438973),
[keyboards](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-gaming-keyboard-3500376)
and [mice](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-gaming-mouse-3515423) you
may already have.

However, the current version is now outdated compared to the Macs currently on
the market. It uses Intel Haswell processors and Intel HD 5000/Intel Iris
Graphics.

Apple has a revamped version of the Mac Pro coming in 2018, which the company
has described as “our highest-end, high-throughput desktop system, designed
for our demanding pro customers.”

During that reveal, Apple’s marketing chief Phil Schiller said: “The Mac mini
is an important product in our lineup and we weren’t bringing it up because
it’s more of a mix of consumer with some pro use.”
